channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: KrebsOnSecurity Hit With Near-Record 6.3 Tbps DDoS
item.description: A massive distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack of over 6.3 terabits per second was launched against KrebsOnSecurity, with the attacker believed to be testing a new Internet of Things (IoT) botnet capable of launching crippling digital assaults. The botnet, known as Aisuru, is reportedly controlled by a 21-year-old individual claiming to reside in Brazil who has been peddling access to their DDoS machine on public Telegram chat channels.

item.title: Mobile carrier Cellcom confirms cyberattack behind extended outages
item.description: Cellcom, a Wisconsin wireless provider, has confirmed that a cyberattack is responsible for the widespread service outage and disruptions that began on May 14, 2025. The attack affected voice and SMS services, leaving customers unable to make phone calls or send text messages. Cellcom's CEO has assured that the company has protocols in place for such incidents and is working to restore full service by the end of the week.

item.title: Premium WordPress 'Motors' theme vulnerable to admin takeover attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: StylemixThemes Motors; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4322; Summary: The Motors WordPress theme contains a privilege escalation vulnerability that allows unauthenticated attackers to hijack administrator accounts and take complete control of websites. This flaw affects all versions up to 5.6.67, and exploitation enables attackers to implant malware, exfiltrate sensitive data, or redirect visitors to dangerous sites.

item.title: VanHelsing ransomware builder leaked on hacking forum
item.description: Vulnerable Product: VanHelsing RaaS; CVE(s): None; Summary: The source code for the VanHelsing ransomware-as-a-service operation's affiliate panel, data leak blog, and Windows encryptor builder was leaked after an old developer tried to sell it on the RAMP cybercrime forum. The leaked code includes the legitimate builder for the Windows encryptor and the source code for the affiliate panel and data leak site, but is incomplete as it does not include the Linux builder or any databases.

item.title: Here’s how Windows 11 aims to make the world safe in the post-quantum era
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses the security concerns surrounding Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) algorithms, specifically the increased key sizes and potential errors introduced into software during the transition away from RSA and Elliptic Curve cryptography.

item.title: SK Telecom says malware breach lasted 3 years, impacted 27 million numbers
item.description: SK Telecom suffered a malware attack that exposed USIM data of 27 million subscribers, including IMSI, USIM authentication keys, network usage data, and SMS/contacts stored in the SIM. The company detected the malware on April 19, 2025, and isolated equipment suspected of being hacked, but initially undetected for nearly three years from June 15, 2022.

item.title: Hazy Hawk gang exploits DNS misconfigs to hijack trusted domains
item.description: A threat actor known as "Hazy Hawk" is hijacking forgotten DNS CNAME records pointing to abandoned cloud services, using the compromised domains to distribute scams, fake apps, and malicious ads. The attacker's technique involves registering a new cloud resource with the same name as the original one, causing the subdomain to resolve to their new site.

item.title: Hazy Hawk Exploits DNS Records to Hijack CDC, Corporate Domains for Malware Delivery
item.description: A threat actor known as Hazy Hawk has been observed hijacking abandoned cloud resources, including Amazon S3 buckets and Microsoft Azure endpoints, by leveraging misconfigurations in DNS records. The hijacked domains are used to host URLs that direct users to scams and malware via traffic distribution systems.

item.title: Kimsuky APT Group Deploys PowerShell Payloads to Deliver XWorm RAT
item.description: This article describes a malware campaign orchestrated by the Kimsuky APT group, using PowerShell payloads to deliver the XWorm Remote Access Trojan (RAT). The campaign involves multi-stage attacks, fileless execution, and Living-off-the-Land Binaries and Scripts (LOLBAS) techniques to evade detection.

item.title: 100+ Fake Chrome Extensions Found Hijacking Sessions, Stealing Credentials, Injecting Ads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Unknown threat actor; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article describes malicious Chrome Browser extensions created by an unknown threat actor since February 2024. These extensions masquerade as seemingly benign utilities but can exfiltrate data, receive commands, and execute arbitrary code. They also enable credential and cookie theft, session hijacking, ad injection, and phishing via DOM manipulation.

item.title: More_Eggs Malware Uses Job Application Emails to Distribute Malicious Payloads
item.description: The article describes the More_Eggs malware, a JavaScript backdoor that exploits human trust through social engineering. It targets HR departments by masquerading as job application emails and uses obfuscated scripts and legitimate system binaries to establish a foothold in targeted environments.

item.title: RVTools hit in supply chain attack to deliver Bumblebee malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Robware RVTools; CVE(s): None; Summary: The official website for the RVTools VMware management tool was taken offline due to a supply chain attack that distributed a trojanized installer, dropping the Bumblebee malware loader on users' machines. The malware is designed to download and execute additional payloads, including Cobalt Strike beacons, information stealers, and ransomware.

item.title: RedisRaider Campaign Targets Linux Servers by Exploiting Misconfigured Redis Instances
item.description: The RedisRaider campaign is a sophisticated Linux worm that targets publicly accessible Redis instances with misconfigured servers. It exploits vulnerabilities to deploy a customized XMRig miner and employs advanced obfuscation, anti-forensics measures, and manipulation of Redis configurations to evade detection. The malware also has a web-based mining component, revealing a broader monetization strategy.

item.title: Service desks are under attack: What can you do about it?
item.description: The article discusses social engineering attacks on service desk agents, where attackers use tactics such as pretexting, vishing, and building urgency and trust to gain initial access. This is often followed by privilege escalation or deploying ransomware. The article highlights the importance of verifying identities and implementing rigorous identity checks to prevent these attacks.

item.title: Hackers Abuse TikTok and Instagram APIs to Verify Stolen Account Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PyPI (Python Package Index); CVE(s): None; Summary: Cybercriminals are leveraging the PyPI to distribute malicious tools designed to exploit TikTok and Instagram APIs for verifying stolen account credentials. These packages, including checker-SaGaF, steinlurks, and sinnercore, automate the process of validating emails and usernames against social media platforms, posing significant supply chain security risks due to their unauthorized network access and malicious behavior.

item.title: Regeneron to Buy 23andMe for $256M Amid Growing Data Privacy Concerns
item.description: The article discusses the acquisition of 23andMe by Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, with concerns about the fate of sensitive genetic information collected from millions of customers. Regeneron has emphasized its commitment to protecting customer data and pledged to comply with existing privacy policies and applicable laws. The acquisition is seen as a significant consolidation in the genetics industry, highlighting the value of large-scale genetic databases in modern drug development.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: Aquatic Panda
item.description: Aquatic Panda is a suspected China-based threat group focused on intelligence gathering and industrial espionage. The group operates within a wider network of government-linked teams and private contractors, reflecting China's modern cyber strategy.

item.title: CISA Includes MDaemon Email Server XSS Flaw in KEV Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: MDaemon Email Server; CVE(s): CVE-2024-11182; Summary: The MDaemon Email Server prior to version 24.5.1c contains a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious JavaScript code via crafted HTML emails, enabling them to execute arbitrary code within the user's browser window and potentially access sensitive data and functionality.

item.title: Hackers Use Weaponized RAR Archives to Deliver Pure Malware in Targeted Attacks
item.description: The article discusses a sophisticated malware campaign targeting Russian organizations with the Pure malware family. The malware is distributed via spam emails containing malicious RAR archives or links to such archives, and once executed, allows attackers to gain persistent access to compromised systems, steal credentials, and exfiltrate data.

item.title: South Asian Ministries Hit by SideWinder APT Using Old Office Flaws and Custom Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): CVE-2017-0199, CVE-2017-11882; Summary: SideWinder threat actors used spear phishing emails with geofenced payloads to target high-level government institutions in Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Pakistan. The attack chain leveraged remote code execution flaws in Microsoft Office (CVE-2017-0199 and CVE-2017-11882) to deploy StealerBot malware, which maintains persistent access and collects sensitive data from compromised hosts.

item.title: AWS Default IAM Roles Found to Enable Lateral Movement and Cross-Service Exploitation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Amazon Web Services; CVE(s): None; Summary: Default IAM roles in AWS services like SageMaker, Glue, EMR, and Lightsail grant overly broad permissions, allowing attackers to escalate privileges, manipulate other AWS services, and compromise entire AWS accounts. These roles can be exploited to perform administrative actions, break isolation boundaries between services, and move laterally across services within the same account.

item.title: Cyberattack on Serviceaide Compromises Data of 480,000 Catholic Health Patients
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Serviceaide; CVE(s): None; Summary: An improperly secured Elasticsearch database left sensitive information of approximately 480,000 patients exposed for nearly seven weeks. The incident was caused by a misconfigured database managed by Serviceaide, which became publicly accessible on September 19, 2024, and was only discovered on November 5.

item.title: Threat Actors Deploy Bumblebee Malware via Poisoned Bing SEO Results
item.description: The article discusses a cyberattack campaign that uses SEO poisoning to distribute the Bumblebee malware. The attackers create fake download websites mimicking legitimate software packages and optimize their malicious sites to rank at the top of Bing search results. The malware is used as a downloader for additional payloads, making it particularly dangerous in developer environments where privileged access could be leveraged for broader attacks or data theft.

item.title: Security Flaw in WordPress Plugin Puts 22,000 Websites at Risk of Cyber Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: StylemixThemes Motors; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4322; Summary: The Motors WordPress theme has an unauthenticated privilege escalation vulnerability that allows attackers to change passwords of any user, including administrators, without requiring prior authentication. This vulnerability, with a critical CVSS rating of 9.8, can be exploited by unauthenticated threat actors to gain complete control over compromised websites, enabling attacks such as uploading malicious files, injecting malware, or redirecting users to phishing sites.

item.title: Critical VMware Cloud Foundation Vulnerability Exposes Sensitive Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Broadcom VMware; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41229, CVE-2025-41230, CVE-2025-41231; Summary: Three significant security vulnerabilities in VMware Cloud Foundation platform allow attackers to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information and internal services. The flaws affect versions 4.5.x and 5.x and require immediate patching as no workarounds are available.

item.title: Danfoss AK-SM 8xxA Series
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Danfoss AK-SM 8xxA Series; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41450; Summary: The AK-SM 800A system manager has an improper authentication vulnerability due to datetime-based password generation, which could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication and execute arbitrary code. The affected versions are prior to R4.2, and Danfoss has released version R4.2 to address the issue.

item.title: Vertiv Liebert RDU101 and UNITY
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Vertiv Liebert RDU101 and Liebert UNITY; CVE(s): CVE-2025-46412, CVE-2025-41426; Summary: The Liebert RDU101 and Liebert UNITY products contain vulnerabilities that could allow an attacker to bypass authentication, cause a denial-of-service condition, or achieve remote code execution.

item.title: Mitsubishi Electric Iconics Digital Solutions and Mitsubishi Electric Products
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mitsubishi Electric Iconics Digital Solutions, ICONICS Product Suite and Mitsubishi Electric MC Works64; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0921; Summary: An execution with unnecessary privileges vulnerability in the AlarmWorX64 MMX Pager agent can allow an attacker to make unauthorized writes to arbitrary files, potentially leading to information tampering or denial-of-service (DoS) conditions on affected PCs.

item.title: AutomationDirect MB-Gateway
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AutomationDirect MB-Gateway; CVE(s): CVE-2025-36535; Summary: The MB-Gateway's embedded webserver lacks authentication and access controls, allowing unrestricted remote access. Successful exploitation could allow attackers to make configuration changes, disrupt operations, or achieve arbitrary code execution with a CVSS v4 base score of 10.0.

item.title: ABUP IoT Cloud Platform
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ABUP IoT Cloud Platform; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4692; Summary: Incorrect Privilege Assignment vulnerability allows an attacker to access device profiles for which they are not authorized by submitting a malicious JSON Web Token (JWT) to the cloud platform. Successful exploitation can escalate privileges to access any device managed by the Cloud Update Platform.

item.title: Assured Telematics Inc (ATI) Fleet Management System with Geotab Integration
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Assured Telematics Inc. Fleet Management System; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4364; Summary: The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to access sensitive file system information or obtain administrative credentials, exposing the system to potential exploitation. Successful exploitation could lead to further unauthorized access and data theft.

item.title: Schneider Electric PrismaSeT Active - Wireless Panel Server
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Schneider Electric PrismaSeT Active - Wireless Panel Server; CVE(s): CVE-2023-4041; Summary: A buffer copy without checking size of input (classic buffer overflow) vulnerability in the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader on ARM allows code injection, authentication bypass. Successful exploitation could result in unauthorized code execution and unavailability of the PrismaSeT Active - Wireless Panel Server for voltage loss monitoring.

item.title: Schneider Electric Modicon Controllers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Schneider Electric Modicon Controllers M241/M251/M258/LMC058; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2875; Summary: The vulnerability, CWE-610, is an externally controlled reference to a resource in another sphere, which can cause a loss of confidentiality when an unauthenticated attacker manipulates a controller's webserver URL to access resources. Exploitation could occur remotely with low attack complexity.

item.title: CISA Releases Thirteen Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: CISA released 13 Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories on May 20, 2025, providing information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. The advisories cover various products from vendors such as ICONICS, Mitsubishi Electric, Siemens, Schneider Electric, and AutomationDirect.

item.title: Schneider Electric Galaxy VS, Galaxy VL, Galaxy VXL
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Schneider Electric Galaxy VS, Galaxy VL, Galaxy VXL; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32433; Summary: A missing authentication vulnerability in the SSH server of affected Schneider Electric products allows an attacker to perform unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) with a low attack complexity. Successful exploitation could grant unauthorized access and execute arbitrary commands without valid credentials.

item.title: Siemens Siveillance Video
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens Siveillance Video; CVE(s): CVE-2025-1688; Summary: Missing encryption of sensitive data in Siemens Siveillance Video allows removal of password protection from system configuration files, affecting backup data sets. Successful exploitation has a high attack complexity and may reset system configuration passwords.

item.title: National Instruments Circuit Design Suite
item.description: Vulnerable Product: National Instruments Circuit Design Suite; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30417, CVE-2025-30418, CVE-2025-30419, CVE-2025-30420; Summary: The Circuit Design Suite contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an attacker to disclose information or execute arbitrary code. Exploitation requires tricking a user into opening a specially crafted SYM file.

item.title: Qilin Exploits SAP Zero-Day Vulnerability Weeks Ahead of Public Disclosure
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer was actively exploited nearly three weeks before its public disclosure. The flaw lacks proper authentication and authorization controls, enabling unauthenticated attackers to upload malicious files like web shells, leading to potential remote code execution.

item.title: WordPress Plugin Flaw Puts 22,000 Websites at Risk of Cyber Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: StylemixThemes Motors WordPress Theme; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4322; Summary: The Motors WordPress theme contains a critical Privilege Escalation vulnerability (CVE-2025-4322) that allows unauthenticated attackers to reset the password of any user, including administrators, thereby gaining full control over affected websites.

item.title: The Crowded Battle: Key Insights from the 2025 State of Pentesting Report
item.description: The article presents findings from the 2025 State of Pentesting Report, highlighting the strategies, tactics, and tools used by CISOs to cope with security alerts, breaches, and growing cyber risks. Key takeaways include the growth of software-based pentesting, increasing trust in automated tools, and the influence of cyber insurance providers on enterprise security priorities.

item.title: DPRK IT Workers Impersonate Polish and US Nationals to Secure Full-Stack Developer Positions
item.description: A sophisticated employment scam network potentially affiliated with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) targets remote engineering and full-stack blockchain developer roles by impersonating Polish and US nationals. The threat actors employ deceptive tactics, including the use of GitHub accounts, portfolio websites, and freelancer profiles to deceive companies into hiring them for full-time or project-based freelance gigs.

item.title: Critical Multer Vulnerability Puts Millions of Node.js Apps at Risk
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm Multer; CVE(s): None; Summary: All versions of Multer from 1.4.4-lts.1 to but not including 2.0.0 are vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks through maliciously crafted multi-part upload requests, potentially crashing Node.js processes and taking down entire web services.

item.title: Instagram Ban Bypass, AI Identity Forgery, and Nova Ransomware Affiliate Drive
item.description: Threat actors are offering various malicious services on underground forums, including an alleged affiliate program for Nova ransomware, deepfake tools for identity manipulation, and databases containing credit card information and SIM registration data. Additionally, a service is being offered to reverse Instagram bans, highlighting the commoditization of platform abuse.

item.title: Duping Cloud Functions: An emerging serverless attack vector
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Cloud Functions; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability was discovered in GCP's Cloud Functions serverless compute service and its Cloud Build continuous integration and continuous delivery pipeline service. An attacker could create or update a cloud function to escalate privileges to the default Cloud Build service account. The vulnerability has since been partially addressed by Google.
FYSA: Cisco Talos' research demonstrated that the technique used to exploit the GCP Cloud Functions vulnerability could be adapted to perform other malicious activities in other cloud-based environments, such as AWS Lambda and Azure Functions. Threat actors can use this method to gather valuable enumeration information about network devices, CPU scheduling, control group container IDs, and more.

item.title: Windows 11 Privilege Escalation Vulnerability Let Attackers Gain Admin Access in Under 300 Milliseconds
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24076; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Windows 11 allowed attackers to escalate privileges from a standard user to system-level administrator in just 300 milliseconds through DLL hijacking. The flaw leveraged a Dynamic-link Library (DLL) hijacking technique within Windows 11's "Mobile devices" feature, enabling attackers to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Deploy MarsSnake Backdoor in Multi-Year Attack on Saudi Organization
item.description: No vulnerabilities mentioned in the article; instead, it discusses threat actors and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) used to target organizations.

item.title: O2 VoLTE Flaw Allows Tracking of Customers’ Locations Through Phone Calls
item.description: Vulnerable Product: O2 UK; CVE(s): None; Summary: The VoLTE implementation in O2 UK's network contained a significant privacy vulnerability that exposed precise location data of call recipients. The vulnerability allowed any caller to access the recipient's IMSI and IMEI numbers, as well as cell tower identification data, which could be used to geolocate the recipient with minimal technical expertise.

item.title: Microsoft Issues Urgent Patch to Resolve BitLocker Recovery Problem
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 10; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical issue affecting Windows 10 devices with specific Intel processors causes unexpected system failures and forces users to enter BitLocker recovery keys. The issue was introduced in the May 13, 2025 security update and is fixed by the emergency update KB5061768, which addresses a severe problem impacting devices with Intel Trusted Execution Technology (TXT) enabled on 10th generation or later Intel vPro processors.

item.title: Malicious npm Package in Koishi Chatbots Steals Sensitive Data in Real Time
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Koishi; CVE(s): None; Summary: The koishi-plugin-pinhaofa plugin for the Koishi chatbot framework contains a data-exfiltration backdoor that scans messages for eight-character hexadecimal strings and silently forwards sensitive data to a hardcoded QQ account, allowing real-time data theft.

item.title: Go-Based Malware Deploys XMRig Miner on Linux Hosts via Redis Configuration Abuse
item.description: The article discusses two separate cybersecurity threats. The first is RedisRaider, a Linux cryptojacking campaign targeting publicly accessible Redis servers. The attackers use a bespoke scanner to identify vulnerable systems and inject malicious cron jobs using Redis's SET command. The end goal is to drop an XMRig miner on compromised systems. The second threat is a targeted campaign exploiting legacy authentication protocols in Microsoft Entra ID, bypassing defenses like MFA and Conditional Access.
